item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My bounty is as boundless as the sea, My love as deep; the more I give to thee, The more I have, for both are infinite." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When he shall die, Take him and cut him out in little stars, And he will make the face of heaven so fine That all the world will be in love with night And pay no worship to the garish sun." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We know what we are, but not what we may be." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "These violent delights have violent ends And in their triump die, like fire and powder Which, as they kiss, consume" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There are more things in Heaven and Earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Good night, good night! parting is such sweet sorrow, That I shall say good night till it be morrow." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Do you see yonder cloud that’s almost in shape of a camel? Polonius: By the mass, and ‘tis like a camel, indeed. Hamlet: Methinks it is like a weasel. Polonius: It is backed like a weasel. Hamlet: Or like a whale? Polonius: Very like a whale." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My words fly up, my thoughts remain below: Words without thoughts never to heaven go." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Edith add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Does such a thing as "the fatal flaw," that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature?" -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Edith add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "Il n'est pas de chagrin qu'un livre ne puisse consoler." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Edith add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Beauty is rarely soft or consolatory. Quite the contrary. Genuine beauty is always quite alarming." -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Edith add a quote by William Shakespear
item.description: "There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so." -- William Shakespear

item.title: Edith add a quote by Arthur Rimbaud
item.description: "Elle est retrouvée! Quoi? -l'Éternité. C'est la mer allée Avec le soleil." -- Arthur Rimbaud

item.title: Edith add a quote by Éric Dupont
item.description: "le sommeil d'un homme est chose sacrée." -- Éric Dupont

item.title: Edith add a quote by Novala Takemoto
item.description: "Snow falling soundlessly in the middle of the night will always fill my heart with sweet clarity" -- Novala Takemoto

item.title: Edith add a quote by François Blais
item.description: "Les graines de tournesol Krispy Kernel, c'est un peu de la marde, tu trouves pas? Ces gens-là sont en business depuis soixante ans (j'ai vérifié) et ils n'ont pas encore trouvé le moyen de produire des graines de tournesol convenables. J'appelle ça rire du monde. Premièrement, le taux d'écales vides par sac est scandaleusement élevé. Et puis, rien qu'à voir on voit bien qu'ils utilisent des graines de mauvaise qualité, toutes petites dont les écales ont tendance à se désagréger, tandis que les Lalumière éclatent sous la dent en produisant un tac! sonore avant de libérer de belles grosses graines. [...]" -- François Blais
